trial_identification.studytitle: The Effectiveness of Global Postural Reeducation Method (GPR) and Conventional Kinesiotherapy on the Treatment of Spine Chronic Pain: Controlled Randomized Trial.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effectiveness of Global Postural Reeducation Method (GPR) and conventional kinesiotherapy on pain, quality of life and functional disability in subjects with chronic spine pain.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Intensity of Pain: Visual Analogue Scale and a portuguese version of the McGill Pain Questionnaire.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline, endpoint (right after the end of the treatment) and follow-up (two months after the end of the treatment).

primaryOutcome.outcome: Quality of Life: Brazilian version of SF-36 Questionnaire (all domains).
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline, endpoint (right after the end of the treatment) and follow-up (two months after the end of the treatment).

primaryOutcome.outcome: Functional Disability: Brazilian version of Roland-Morris Questionnaire.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline, endpoint (right after the end of the treatment) and follow-up (two months after the end of the treatment).

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Postural Evaluation measured by Computerized Photogrammetry made with ALCImagem Software.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline, endpoint (right after the end of the treatment) and follow-up (two months after the end of the treatment).
At baseline, endpoint (right after the end of the treatment) and follow-up (two months after the end of the treatment).

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Respiratory Function Evaluation performed by: Manovacuometry, Expiratory Peak Flow and Thoracic Perimetry.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline, endpoint (right after the end of the treatment) and follow-up (two months after the end of the treatment).

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Subjects who have mechanical chronic pain in any segment of the spine (neck, thorax and/or low back) lasting at least three months.

trial_design.concealment: After computerized randomization, the sequential numbers were kept in opaque non-translucent closed envelopes. As the patients were evaluated, they were allocated in one of the three groups.
trial_design.sequence: The allocation sequence were obtained using GraphPad Statmate 1.0 software.

ethicsAndSummary.summary:
Primary purpose of the study: to assess the effectiveness of Global Posture Reeducation Method in the treatment of chronic spine pain.
Hypothesis: The Global Posture Reeducation Method presents better results when compared to Conventional Kinesiotherapy and to no treatment of chronic spine pain.
